intro: Odontites fennicus, commonly known as the Finnish toothplant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Odontites fennicus is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
